name: GetAsanaUsers
description:
Retrieve Asana user records across workspaces.

Fetches user records from Asana for all users in workspaces and organizations accessible to the authenticated user. An optional workspace ID can be provided to filter results. The data is sorted by user ID and requires the 'users:read' scope.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace or organization to filter users on.

value_schema.description: The workspace or organization ID to filter users on.

parameters.name: filter_by_team_id
parameters.description: The team ID to filter users in Asana. It allows you to specify a particular team to narrow down the user results.

value_schema.description: The team ID to filter users on.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of user records to return per page. Must be between 1 and 100.

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: pagination_offset_token
parameters.description: Offset token for pagination, used to fetch subsequent pages of results. Only valid when using an offset returned in a prior request.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional user properties to include in the response. Use this to fetch additional fields excluded by default.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty formatting of the response for easier readability. Recommended for debugging as it increases response size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The workspace or organization ID to filter users on.

value_schema.description: The workspace or organization ID to filter users on.

parameters.description: The team ID to filter users on.

value_schema.description: The team ID to filter users on.
